title: Facebook, Bakkt, GE, Alphabet: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today; Facebook shares rose premarket after social-media giant posted earnings; General Electric also gained on results
text:
* Bakkt shot up 55% premarket. The stock more than tripled Monday after Mastercard said it had partnered with the crypto firm to enable cryptocurrency card payments.

* General Electric rose 1.5%. The industrial conglomerate beat Wall Street forecasts for earnings per share, and said orders rose 42%.

* 3M topped predictions of net income and sales, saying demand for its products remained strong. Shares rose 2.8%.

* Google owner Alphabet ticked up 1.2%. Alphabet is one of several companies, including Microsoft, Twitter and Robinhood Markets, due to report after the close.

Sundar Pichai, Alphabet's chief executive, at WSJ Tech Live on Oct. 18. PHOTO: The Wall Street Journal

* Hasbro gained 2.1% ahead of the bell on a 15% rise in net earnings in the third quarter.

* Crane's stock price gained 2.7% after it reported earnings and gave the green light to a share repurchase plan.

* Brown & Brown reported better third-quarter results than analysts had forecast. The insurance agency's share price rose 2.5%.

* Rising profits and sales gave shares of Packaging Corp. of America a 1.6% boost premarket.

* Shares of Digital World Acquisition, the SPAC that has agreed to take former President Donald Trump's social-media venture public, rose 2.2% premarket. That's a modest move compared with DWAC's surge in price over the past week.

* Phunware, an unprofitable tech company that worked for the former president's campaign, fell 6.3%, unwinding a small part of its recent gains.

Chart of the Day

* U.S. banks are overrun with cash. So they are loading up on debt, propelling a corporate-bond market that otherwise had slowed from last year's pandemic-induced debt bonanza.

Write to Joe Wallace at joe.wallace@wsj.com

Facebook, Bakkt, GE, Alphabet: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
